intro: Beauverdia sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers and hairy, branched stems. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
